Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Comfortable and helpful”
Reviews.Author: El C
Reviews.Content: My wife came to Rome not knowing what to expect being our first time visiting. We were introduced to Carlo (one of the concierges) who was very helpful throughout our stay. He took the time to ensure we were comfortable and helped us out with getting around. The room itself was comfortable but the bathroom was a little cramped and hot water was a little scarce. All in all the location was great and we found ourselves walking to a great cafe where we enjoyed a cappucino before our ventures began. This place was a great value (Rome is pricey) and was close to the city. Carlo was the difference maker in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good price, OK location and some kinks.”
Reviews.Author: rpccc43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa after arriving in Rome for a pre cruise look around. It's tucked away in a nice quiet residential neighborhood a few blocks NE of the Vatican. The location was not bad for anyone who was willing to walk to the sites which we did, otherwise it was a bit off the path. There was a municipal bus that stopped nearby that would take you to old Rome. Some coins and a good bus map will get you there and back. The entrance to the hotel, like many in Italy it seems, is a bit subtle and you have to watch for it. We even walked by it one evening after we had checked in. The service was good although not terribly outgoing but they were helpful when asked questions about getting around and for recommendations on where to eat. The room was essentially a one bedroom apartment sized to European standards. When we reserved we asked for a room with two beds. Expecting a bedroom with 2 beds we were surprised to see one bed in the bedroom and a day bed kind of couch in the living room. Furnishings were new and of good KD furniture quality but a bit spartan. The quality of the bedding was not great either especially on the day bed. The bathroom was the biggest challenge. We had read in other reviews on this site about a bathroom that was tiny and with a shower that leaked all over the floor. Unless all the bathrooms are all the same I believe we had this bathroom. It was small by US standards but impeccably clean, nicely finished and had all the requisite fixtures for a European bathroom. The shower had no curtain but was 1/3 enclosed with a glass door. Unfortunately no matter how hard one tried to keep the shower water (with a hand held head) away from the door water flooded the floor and had to be mopped up. A bar and shower curtain would be an easy fix in this case. We both ended up sitting in the tub and taking sponge bath and rinse. The hot water is scalding hot and we both burned ourselves a tad on the faucet body. There was a considerable amount of mold & mildew around the tub area as well, way more than many people would be comfortable with. My biggest beef was noise. It would appear that the Villa has some longer term residents that have no compunction about carrying on long and loud conversations in the hallways at any time of day. The high ceilings in the hallway only echoed the noise making it difficult to sleep. I was also awakened after midnight by a howling dog that was obviously in the building and was allowed to carry on for an hour or so. The bathroom quirks I can forgive but the noise will prevent a return visit for my part.

Reviews.Title: “VALUE FOR MONEY IN ROME”
Reviews.Author: thekingskent
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Spacious and comfortable accommodation. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for the price”
Reviews.Author: Robert P
Reviews.Content: The rooms could have been cleaner and better equipped - for example there was no kettle - but for Rome prices we concluded that overall this was probably reasonably good value. There is a self service (pay) washing machine and tumble drier at the hotel which was useful and the staff were helpful. The 10 minute walk to the Metro mentioned in other reviews is an underestimate - about 20 minutes would be fair at a reasonable pace. However, I can recommend the 913 bus which stops outside the hotel and goes into the centre - it seems to run every 5-10 minutes and was an excellent way of getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: sandyatgrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at Villa Tassoni in September 2011. We arrived very late on a Saturday night and reception were there to welcome us. We had an apartment that had a single bed downstairs with kitchenette and balcony and two flights of stairs up to a double bedroom and bathroom.The bathroom had a small slipper bath with shower in which we found quite difficult to use, the shower screen was broken and the floor tiles became very slippery. Apart from that it was fine. Only basic kitchen utensils,no microwave or kettle but a fridge and freezer and a grill and two hot rings.We found the beds comfortable and loved sitting on the balcony in the evenings. We bought a weekly metro and bus ticket and started our journey by filling our water bottles at the fountain across the road next to the bus stop. Two stops to Cipro Metro stop or stayed on the 913 longer to next metro.There is a Barclays cash machine right outside the villa and a small supermarket left and the first right. Very good pizzas just up the road right from villa or had a takeaway from the pub which is down the road left. We tried a restaurant on the corner just down from the villa which someone had previously recommended but we were very disappointed. Food turned up cold and not the steak we ordered. Service was not good. Although this is a small bus ride away from metro we found buses frequent and metro easy to use to see all the sites of Rome. We were ripped off by a guide who charged us 15E for a tour of the Colosseum but left us after 20 mins of information and on a day of free entry. We also did an open top bus trip which was enjoyable but was told it was two hours but it was less than one. We found lots of the slots for earphones for the commentary were broken so missed most of it until lots of people got off the bus.We went to see the Pope, who came out to meet the people at the Vatican.(Every Wednesday about 10.30am.) Highlights for us was the Vatican Museum and the Sistine Chapel. Would stay again at the Tassoni, Always clean and welcoming to come back to after a days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: closam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Tassoni for 3 nights in august 2010. The Villa was 10 mins walk from the nearest metro station( Cipro) & 15mins walk to the Vatican . I was alone with my daughter and it was a very safe and quiet neighbourhood. The accommodation was quite nice, quiet & clean and fairly large. It had everything we needed including a small kitchen area, a small terrace, a safe parking across the street, a laundry room on the first floor, a grocery store 5 minutes away and a nice pizzeria one block away. There is free WIRED internet, but no wifi. The staff was very helpful and always nice and polite. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room as we were out sightseeing most of the time but it was a great value for the money. I would definitely go back there and recommend Villa Tassoni to anyone who want to spend some times in this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “The best choice”
Reviews.Author: alba1992
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at the Villa Tassoni for a week in July and it was the perfect choice. Location wise, it's fine if you're willing to have a bit of a walk - the hill isn't that steep but after you've spent 6 hours walking around, it's tempting to catch the bus from the bottom of the hill just to avoid it. The bedroom was small but the bed unnecessarily huge, which made it a bit squashed, but unless you spend a lot of time sitting watching TV it won't be a problem. The living room was of a decent size, with a kitchenette (2 hobs, no oven or anything), a microwave, a dining table and 2 cabinets. It was absolutely clean which I loved, and the cleaners came in daily to empty bins and wipe down the tables. I'm honestly not sure how often we got the sheets changed or the towels, but it was at least once in the week. The neighbourhood is safe and quiet, and the Carrefour supermarket (5 minute walk away) is five times cheaper than the central Roman equivalent. There's a nice pizza place that did takeaways for 5 euros, and an Irish pub down the road which had a nice atmosphere. Overall the hotel was a great base for visiting, as it's only 10 minutes to the Cipro metro, 15 minutes to the Vatican, and 30 seconds from buses. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TIJUMI2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Triple Suite for one week and absolutely loved it! I traveled with my boyfriend and my son and the layout was perfect with a single bed downstairs (along with the table/chairs and sink/refrigerator/microwave) and upstairs was a queen sized bed, the bathroom and a smaller room along with the exit to the balcony. The bathroom is small, and the shower even smaller...but you get used to it quickly. For the price we paid this hotel was very nice and just what we were looking for. Our beds were made daily and they changed the towels every few days. The Cipro Metro stop was about a 10-15 minute walk and we used the Metro to get around everywhere. Also, on the way to the Metro there was a public "water fountain" where you could stop and fill up your bottles (and fill them on your way home) - it was great. There is also a delicious pizza/pasta place just a few minutes up the street and we ate there three times. They have a very nice outside eating area and the service was great, the food spectacular. If you're looking for a budget-conscious place to stay, without sacrificing quality...definitely check this place out. The staff was great and very helpful, and it was super clean, quiet and nice to come back to after a fun-filled day of seeing Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoMo1017
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very reasonably priced. The staff were friendly. The room was a bit cramped, and the furnishings were odd and old, I believe. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. But, if you're not planning to stay in the room, then it serves its purpose well. This a no-frills kind of place. As I said, the staff were friendly and very accommodating. The hotel is in a residential area, so the neighborhood was rather quiet. There was a really good pizzeria about a block away, but other than that, can't say that we explored the neighborhood much nor did there seem to be much open or happening in the immediate neighborhood. The 913 bus (that runs down to the Ottaviano metro) stops right in front of the hotel, but no matter what time of day or night we were on it, it was ALWAYS crowded. We figured out a trick by the end. Skip the first bus and catch the second. They're not spaced that far apart, and everyone crowds on to the first one, leaving much more room on the second one. Seriously - SUPER crowded. lol Once at the metro, you can get to most of the tourist sites in the city or walk about 10-15 minutes straight down Via Ottaviano and you're at the Vatican. Fairly easy to get around. Be forewarned cabs to the hotel tend to be pricey. Much more pocket friendly to do metro and/or buses.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Villa Tassoni!”
Reviews.Author: Leslieg61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at Villa Tassoni. The location is great and everyone working there was very helpful with maps and even made a reservation for us for the Borghese Gallery. It was very easy to get public transportation from Villa Tassoni, which is important in Rome since it is such a big city. The bus stop was right across the street from the hotel and we took that right to the metro stop. Right as you get off the metro stop for Ottaviano there is a great coffee bar for breakfast, which is how we started each morning. The room is spacious and had a mini kitchen, although we only used the refrigerator. We would definitely reccommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and easy access Rome by bus and metro !”
Reviews.Author: Bunnytoon
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its great location that near to Vatican City and at a safe and quiet neighbourhood. We came to this hotel by bus and when we reached the hotel bus stop, we took a while to search for the hotel as its signboard is really too small to be noticeable. The two hotel staff (one Italian and one Philipino) are friendly and both speak English. There is no lift access to our room that situated at 2nd floor on the right side of the lobby. However, there is a small lift to serve the rooms at the left side of lobby. Thanks to the Italian staff who helped me to carry my luggage up to the room. As expected, the room is clean, not big but just good enough for couple like us, with air-conditioning, a small LCD tv and bathroom with heater and bathtub. We took bus to Cipro and Ottaviano station and then take metro to travel everywhere in Rome. Rome is really a beautiful place that full of history, impressive sculpture and architecture. I will definitely go back to this hotel again. Transport Tips : We reached the hotel from FCO airport by taking the SIT bus (Eur 8) which will go to Piazza Cavour and Termini. As the hotel is located close to Vatican City, so we aligned at Piazza Cavour and then take bus no. 913 which will stop in front of the hotel. To go to Vatican City or Ottaviano Station, you can take bus no. 913 or 907 (about 3 stops) to Cipro Station. The bus stop is just right opposite the hotel. Travel Tips : Buy 3-Day Roma Pass which allows you to have unlimited rides on bus & metro and enter to two museum/attraction for free and subsequent other entry at discounted rate. Join a Vatican City tour (Eur 40) to avoid the long queue. Don't worry about finding the tour package as the tour agent will approach you directly while you are queuing outside the Vatican Museum. Food Tips : The nearby Italian restaurant - Nuraghe Sardo Ristorante down the hill towards Vatican City serves nice steak at reasonable price. Another good stuff is the Chinese restaurant that is not far away from hotel towards the up hill where you can find cheap and nice fried rice at Eur 2.50 and other good dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: paulvu84
Reviews.Content: The location of this villa is very close to the Vatican City and metro stations. It's a 15 minute walk to Cipro Musei stop and 20 min walk to Ottaviano. You can also take the 999 or 913 bus from Ottaviano to the hotel. The bus runs every 10-15min so it's better to wait than to walk up a hill. You would want to get off after the Phillippines Embassy bus stop. The room is decent size, but the bathroom is tiny and has mold. There is also a kitchen in our room, which we used once to reheat our pizza one night. The bed was a bit old and uncomfortable. There is free WIRED internet, but no wifi. The drive to the FCO airport is a good half an hour ride. The hotel provided this shuttle service for 55 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Italian living in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: The_stone_traveller
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely Italian-feel place with some fantastic staff. Unfortunately, it was raining when we arrived, but we were checked in by Ubaldo, who was charming and gave us an umbrella to use- let me tell you not everywhere is like that! It was a small act of kindness that goes a long way. Tassoni is located conveniently for any number of buses to take you to Citro or Piazza Cavour, and if you're walking Citro metro is about 15 minutes. There are a few shops nearby for provisions, as the rooms have a kitchenette to prepare basic food if you like. The rooms were rustic, which is what we like, but if you're looking for a faceless 21st Century hotel, this isn't for you. It was however, very much for us, and we would return tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, close to the Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: Hayley59
Reviews.Content: We arrived at midnight and the receptionist was up waiting for us at the front door which was a nice touch since we got scammed 100 euros by a taxi. The metro station is about a 10 minute walk away but it's not too bad. The Vatican is about a 15 minute walk but definitely not a hassle. My boyfriend and I did the hop on hop off tours which stop at the Vatican so our "transporation" around Rome was taken care of since we could just walk there from the hotel. The room was great. It had a stove top and fridge with a sink and dishes. I recommend washing the dishes first. Bring your own dishsoap and towel since those are not provided. Huge room for the two of us so that was nice. Internet is hard to connect to through iphone. Also the showers are really short. My boyfriend couldn't stand up straight. Overall the hotel is great! One thing to notice is booking through their website they say they charge you a deposit, but they never actually charge your card. So you will still owe the full price upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.”
Reviews.Author: gabryluglio95
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the date.. I stayed in March 2010 with my Grandma and her friend. It was pleasure! The 2 employees, Sebastian and an older gentleman were very helpful and nice! They let us use the office computer to print out our plane tickets and do some Facebook updating.. It is a great location too! A safe neighborhood (The 3 of us walked to dinner a few times..) There is a cute flower market across the street, a fresh Vegetable market - The owners were very friendly there! A restaurant, where I ate dinner a few times. They have outside tables and inside tables and a little cafe where I ate Breakfast. The hotel is kind of off the beaten path, but it was a gem and was still central to all of Rome's main sights. If I ever went to Rome again, I would most likely stay at the Villa Tassoni again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, awsome sevice!”
Reviews.Author: chickabeeb
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Villa Tassoni for two and a half weeks in August, and we loved it! The room itself was extremely spacious (2 bedrooms, a bathroom, a living room and a full kitchen) and the staff was eager to help us in any way that we needed. My sisters room had a water mark on the wall, looked like someone upstairs had run over the tub, and the hotel actually had her room repainted... now thats service lol. The area was great very easy to hop on a bus that takes you 2 blocks from the Spanish Steps. Easy to get to and from all attractions and a safe enough neighborhood, we would go for evening walks and never had any problems at all. Around the corner from the Villa was a small fruit store and the woman who owned/ran it was wonderful and the produce was amazing. Free internet was a huge plus to get work done away from home. The only down side was that there is absolutely no TV, they have a satalite but the only english cannel was CNN, that and the beds were not really what we expected, they were more like cot matresses not the most comfortable sleeping but not horrible either...oh ya and when they say 'coffee pot' they dont mean the regular coffee pots that we know, so I strongly advise taking instant coffee if you want a descent cup of coffee while you are there. All in all I would recommend this hotel and would definately stay there if I ever go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION, BUT ROOMS DISAPPOINTING”
Reviews.Author: jjcmeiring
Reviews.Content: We were not impressed with the rather cool and unfriendly reception we had at this location. The bed was very uncomfortable (not a double base set), the kitchenette was very poorly equipped and falling apart and the shower cubicle something to laugh about. I could hardly fit into the shower which had folding sides, and I am a lean person.

Reviews.Title: “Not brilliant but would recommend and stay there again”
Reviews.Author: scampyinrome
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I were there for 2 and a half weeks in September / October 2010. We chose this place because of the price and location. We werent expecting a 5 star experience and it wasnt. There was no dishwashign detergent, no tea towels, when we arrived the frodge needed to be defrosted and the staff were far from friendly (they were polite however). Despite these small issues, the positives far outweighed them. The location was great, 15 min walk to the vatiocan. People on here have mentioned the 'steep hill' - honestly, it's not that bad at all. Maybe if you elderly is may be an issues I guess. The rooms were small but comfortable. The bed's were great. We were on the 3rd floor and had no street noise. There are laundry facilities which were handy including a dryer. The Pizzeria and bakery around the corner were brilliant. Had lunch nearly every day at the bakery. Despite the minor issues already mentioned, I would stay there again, no question, and recommend it to my friends. By the way, for the tech geeks like me, the high speed internet mentined is hardly high speed. You'll download at about 600k/sabout adsl2+ speeds. But hey, it was free and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome ....”
Reviews.Author: Jon_R5
Reviews.Content: I spent many hours researching places to stay in Rome and found that accommodation was either unbelievably expensive or of a poor quality. There didn't seem to be anything in between and for a family of six I wanted a reasonable price but didn't want to stay anywhere that wasn't safe, clean or comfortable. Then I found Villa Tassoni . Excellent price, lovely clean comfortable place to stay and safe in a a nice area of the city. We booked 3 suites which they gave us together on the 1st floor. Worked out brilliantly. The kitchen area and fridge were absolutely perfect for us. The staff were friendly and very helpful and we couldn't fault the place at all. The only improvement would be if it was closer to the main tourist centre of Rome. The walk back up the hill was fine but at the end of a long day walking and sightseeing it took it out of you somewhat. We could have got the bus but chose not to so that was our decision but it was only 10 minutes from Villa Tassoni to the Metro station and 20 minutes to the Vatican Museums. The Pizza restaurant up the hill was delightful and both shops just before it were great for pastries, rolls, milk, bread, drinks etc. I would definitely stay at Villa Tassoni again, no question.

Reviews.Title: “A cultured break in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: lorddodo
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we needed somewhere relatively cheap to stay and close to all the landmarks/places of interest-however, it was a 15-20 minute walk up a steep hill from the nearest tube station which was quite intensive after an early start and a busy day roaming Rome. Hotel staff friendly and helpful, also spoke very good English. The room had a small kitchnette-ideal to keep costs down and great if you don't want to eat out all of the time. Room comfortable and tidy but not a great deal of hot water-we had to plan our showers out on a daily basis. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to other-although there were a few negative points, the postive points and overal experience outweighed these.

Reviews.Title: “Ciao- We Came, We Saw, We Conquered!”
Reviews.Author: Arias-Chacon
Reviews.Content: Residence Villa Tassoni will always remain a special spot in our hearts as it happens to turn out, the corner of delle medaglie d'oro (the physical street of the hotel) and c.nepote (side street) is a stair wall that leads to other resident communities (you can view into the court area of Residence Villa Tassoni from here) and is also the location where my boyfriend proposed to me. Our Experience: Immediately upon arrival, we were five hours early. I was not sure if we would wait or if there was an early check in fee as it is the normative for our culture, however, I must say, the staff was extremely inviting and very helpful. They allowed for us to check in without hassle or worry and even provided a map with circled locations to see. The map includes the MUST See’s of Rome. The hotel staff makes it convenient for you and your party. The rooms are exactly as they call it, studio size equipped with all your basic essentials. Our studio room was absolutely perfect for two people as more than likely, you time will be well spent outside in the city. The room we got was number 9 on the second level which happen to overlook the rear of the building (concrete court). It is very quite there and peaceful through out the day and night. We felt safe walking all around the area and noticed a considerable amount in difference with prices when eating near the hotel area versus the tourist hot spots. We managed to stay away from the popular tourist hot spots for food and ventured off to other areas and even on a couple of occasions, we cooked our own breakfast in kitchen. Other Tad Bits of Information: The service for the room was great. We received fresh hand towels everyday and the room was freshened up on a daily basis. We were not sure if we ask for towels and new sheets but we managed just fine with the two large towels for the week and the sheets we had were fine. If you plan to do a lot of walking, more than likely, you'll have many showers during the dawn and evening hours so we were not concerned over fresh towels and sheets daily or every other day as the showers did the purpose. The experience is what we came for. Either way, the room was still clean and fresh. Recommendations: If you have not planned your guided tours already, you can do this through the hotel. We booked one tour in the States and than the rest while we were at the hotel. Please use the hotel staff in the office to book for you. Our inadvertent mistake was walking the city and finding the main office (Carranni Tours) for tours. They advertisement shows FREE pick up and basically you confirm your pick up when you reserve. We went inside and booked the tour but the next day nobody came like they said they would. We asked the hotel staff if they usually run late. For the most part, use the office to book. It is amazing at the difference in treatment when using the hotel versus walking in. Please BOOK ALL YOUR TOURS through them if possible and not at the main office if you use the same company we did. It will be a much smoother transition for you and your party. To Eat: Try the Nuraghe Sardo Ristorante. They are on the same street as the hotel but down the hill directly at a corner. The ristorante is yellow in color and has outside seating available. They are extremely polite and will show you the best time. The old man waiter is the best! Depending on how fast you walk, the average time down hill for us was no longer than five minutes to the ristorante. We will be happy to answer any questions if there are any on the hotel. Please feel free to ask. There is much more to know than I can type in this review, especially if this is your first time in Europe. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a first time Rome visitor”
Reviews.Author: Stardom13
Reviews.Content: So much to see, so little time. Glad we stayed at Villa Tassoni not only for it's central location to move around the Vatican and Rome but for it's safe, clean and time-share like accomodation. My wife and I stayed there for 4 nights in a comfortable unit with a queen size bed (clean linens changed every other day), clean Bathroom with ample hot water, mini ref in the kitchen, dinette table, a couch to sit while watching BBC news (only english broadcast channel) in a 17" monitor. And a balcony facing the not so noisy street. Staff is friendly and will give you advise and directions. A good Chinese restaurant and a Pizzeria is just a block up the street on the same side. A well stocked Supermarket is a short walk on the left side about a block as well as a deli like store where you can buy Bus tickets. We bought a 4 day Metro/Autobus ticket that allowed us to unlimited Bus and Metro train ride. Walk to the bus stop across the street and take Bus 913 if you want to go to downtown where you can either take the Metro train to various sights or walk around. Claudio at the front office will give you a map showing easy directions to and from different attractions. We enjoyed our Rome/Vatican trip and will definitely definitely stay at Villa Tassoni again.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tassoni review and transport tips”
Reviews.Author: sova
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Villa Tassoni for three nights in early May. We bought Roma Passes at the airport and caught the FM1 train to Tuscolana then walked around the corner to the Ponte Lungo metro and from there got off at Cipro. We took the hotels advice and walked 3 minutes to the Gloria del Eroi bus stop and caught the first bus that came along (there is a choice of 4 buses that all go past the hotel). It was two bus stops to the hotel. Staff were friendly and efficient. Hotel locks up at 2300 but you have keys to the front gates and hotel as well as the room. We stayed in Apartment 13 which is at the back which was good because the front facing rooms overlook the main road and could get a bit noisy and I guess it was about 30 square metres including a small kitchenette. In general we would leave the hotel in the morning and walk 10 mins to the big roundabout junction and then decide whether to walk another 10 mins to St Peters Square, get the bus or metro. In the evening we would either take the metro or the bus 913 which terminates close to the Spanish Steps. I recommend Villa Tassoni for it's location but you need to speak a bit of Italian if you are going to stop for breakfast somewhere local. On our way back we caught the Leonardo Express from Termini. Buy the tickets at the station newsagents and leave at least 10 minutes to walk to the platform.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in Rome”
Reviews.Author: jackiemenn
Reviews.Content: Preferring an apartment to a hotel because they tend to be larger, more personal and more flexible we believe we made a good choice in selecting the Villa Tassomi. We stayed in March 2010 for 6 nights. Our room overlooked the busy main road which I expect was more noisy than a room which didn't, but for us it was not a problem because we live on a busy main road at home and don't forget this apartment is situated in central Rome which is a capital city so you should expect some noise! We arrived early but our room was ready. Everyone was very welcoming and friendly and we were provided with a map pointing out all the key sites, supermarket, bus stops restaurants etc. The room was cleaned daily with towels and sheets changed every other day. For the English amongst us there isn't an electric kettle so if you don't fancy boiling pans of water for hot drinks bring one along. The kitchenette is simple but adequate so long as you don't expect to do major cooking. The apartment is simply yet sensitively and attractively furnished in line with its historic roots whilst being good value for money. The bathroom was a bit cramped but as you don't spend much time in it it is fine. As others have described, the villa is located in a residential area about 15 minutes walk from the Vatican. There is a bus stop opposite which takes you down into the centre plus the metro (Cipro) at the bottom of the hill - or you can walk which we preferred to do most of the time. There is a more than adequate supermarket within a five minute walk (first right and then first left down the road) plus a good Pizzeria just up the road which was always busy with local people. All in all we would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: AmySMC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over New Year's and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They let us check in at 7 AM when we arrived from an overnight bus ride. They gave us a map of Rome and marked some places we could walk to on New Year's Day when most businesses were closed. When we were leaving, they arranged a taxi to the airport for us. Our room was clean. The location was great because we could easily walk to the Vatican or the subway station. My only complaint is that the hot water tank for our bathroom was very small and took a long time to reheat. Overall, we got a great deal for the 3 nights we stayed, and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Central and high speed Internet”
Reviews.Author: VikingTrondheim
Reviews.Content: Central and high speed Internet A nice hotel to start a walk around Rome. It will take 10 min to get to the Vatican from where you can reach all the central sights by foot. On the same side of the street going upwards (100 meters) you will find a good pizzeria and a nice inexpensive Chinese restaurant (150 meters). This way you may dine close to the hotel in the evening. Supermarked the old style 10 min down on the same side. Fridge. Clean and new towels every day. Very helpful staff, rooms a bit dark though. Safe. Easy to get breakfast close to the hotel. Enjoy a fantastic Rome. A Norwegian traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vatican”
Reviews.Author: bubbles_smith75
Reviews.Content: Nice apartments, very very noisy if you are on the street side - probably quieter at the back. reasonably clean. world's smallest tv but then you are in Rome. Not much in the immediate vicinity but a short stroll and there are restaurants, markets and the vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a 3 star hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jill1London
Reviews.Content: I am travelling with my 14 month old son and my husband ..At first we are very hesitated to bring our son as this is our first time holidaying with a family.. I am quite surprise this hotel had a great clean crib for us ( for free) and we had a nice clean room.. with everyday changing towels and clean floor. Most of the time ,we had our breakfast outside - opposite the Cipro metro station. Dont expect alot from this hotel as it is cheap to book in low season. I would recommend for couples not family with babies (with stroller),, The only 2 things I would complain is the cold room at night.. even you had adjust the temperature to the highest and the walking distance up the hill with a stroller is very tiring. Overall it is ok and I dun expect much as it is a 3 star hotel/ apartment with no breakfast provided.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jon_P2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks ... clean, prompt service and homely. Very near the Bar, Tabacchi, Pizzeria, Fermatta ... excellent jump off point to the Vatican. Service with a smile. Fabrizzio and Sebastiano are gems.

Reviews.Title: “4*? You must be joking. 2* at the very most”
Reviews.Author: chewedpup
Reviews.Content: We wanted a 4* hotel near the Vatican or in central Rome, for under US$200 a night - so maybe we were asking a lot - what we got was a suite (bedroom plus living room, with the bare minimum in furniture) in a lovely residential part of Rome - far away from the tourist area which suited us just fine (although it is A REAL HIKE from any of the tourist attractions, apart from the Vatican) - and 2 km up a hill, so if you have trouble walking, this isn't for you. Having said that, there are plenty of buses that can take you there - and there are GREAt non-touristy restaurants thereabout - so the area is great. The suite was pretty poor - enough hot water for only one of us to shower - and not even a bar of soap ANYWHERE!!!! I've never stayed anywhere in my life where there hasn't been a tiny bar of soap somewhere. But no, nothing in sight. Supposedly self-contained - with stovetop/hob, sink, fridge etc., but no cleaning supplies anywhere, not a sponge in sight - nothing - so if you make crumbs, you can't even clean up. VERY basic accommodation - 2* at best - but it was very clean - and again, the area could not have been better. Found some wonderful coffee shops where they greeted us like locals and made us feel at home - not like Central Rome where they treated tourists like second class citizens.... so would we stay there again? Probably not, we'd prefer somewhere more central, where it doesn't take 45 mins by cab to get home (when there's no traffic)....but if there wasn't something available in Central Rome - then sure. Great free internet access in lobby, using their computer.

Reviews.Title: “Left A LOT to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: londonyc
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting much. A clean room, comfortable bed, shower with hot water, soap, plenty of towels, and a clock. We got... a tiny oom cold water tons of towels It was the bare minimum. BARE. The staff responded promptly when we informed them that our hot water was lacking....but the next day it ran out again. The location is ok. Not amazing. We wanted to save money so we really didn't care about the quality of the property. But hot water and a comfortable bed really are two things we weren't willing to compromise on. Won't make this mistake again. Sorry there are no photos - our camera broke before we could document anything :)

Reviews.Title: “Villa Tassoni was such a delight.”
Reviews.Author: acrossseaandsky
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Villa Tassoni, Via Medaglie D'Ore 138 from 25th August to Mid December 2007 while I was a studying in Rome. I choose this residence because the alternatives were far too expensive for a prolonged stay. I had a studio apartment and I was so thrilled with it. It comprised a bathroom, bedroom and kitchenette where one could prepare a light meal. I had cable TV, a direct phone link to my room and a free broadband connection. Initially, I was not able to connect my computer because of the difference in the connections between Italy and my country but it was immediately dealt with by the staff. One man allowed me to share his wireless connection until the adapter for my computer was got. The house was always kept spotless and my room was cleaned every day with bed linen and towels changed twice a week. Since the weather got cold in mid October the place was beautifully heated which made it very comfortable. I found a very welcoming and friendly atmosphere among the staff and management. The studio was very secure and that was important to me since I was alone. The local area was quiet yet every type of shop and amenity was available there. Transport in Rome is excellent and buses and Metro lines were so easily accessible from Villa Tassoni. From the Termini Station in central Rome you can go to almost any where in Europe. Visiting Rome is a tremendous experience and it was an added bonus to live in the Villa which has an old world charm though very comfortably maintained. During my stay I met people from many different parts of the world and they also spoke of the tremendous experience it is to visit Rome and be able to get to places of interest so easily. Granted there were crowds of tourists everywhere so it was a welcome relief to withdraw from the hustle and bustle back to the peace and quiet of the Villa on some occasions. I found Rome to be such a marvelous experience and if I ever had a chance to visit Rome again I would certainly stay at Villa Tassoni.... so affordable, a really tremendous place to stay. Dominica Murphy. Ireland

Reviews.Title: “You don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: loukoumaki1978
Reviews.Content: This residence advertises itself as the equivalent of a four star hotel, but that couldn't be further from the truth. My apartment had none of the amenities promised/advertised on the website: no air conditioning (a particular hardship considering the wretched 95 degree heatwave this summer); no working phone line; no working television (one channel of fuzzy "snow"); no extra set of keys (I was sharing one set of keys with another student whose schedule was opposite mine... what a mess! Not to mention that our single set of keys didn't open the main gate to the residence, so we had to beg people to let us in at night... And when we begged for a spare set, we were told to go to the nearest hardware store to make our own copies); no laundry service (this was a special service purportedly organized by our university with Tassoni, but when we inquired about it, we were given puzzled looks and told to go to a laundrymat); no working intercom to buzz in one's roommate or visitors (a particular problem when you have no working phone line either); no fans (you have to go to the desk and beg for one, and the one we got was broken); irregular staff hours (during office hours, the staff was rarely in the office and acted put upon when we asked for anything); no facilities tour upon arrival (we were here a month and only on the LAST DAY learned that there was in fact a breakfast room somewhere on premises... nice to know after weeks of spending money on breakfast!!); and an internet connection that was sporadic at best (which made it impossible to get any work done from the apartment). The staff were unhelpful, the room was dirty, we rarely received fresh towels and linens, and we had to resort to purchasing our own toilet paper because the maids refused to leave us any! The neighborhood in which the residence is situated has nothing to offer, and is a fifteen minute walk from the nearest subway station. It's not even in the city center proper, and is not located on any city center maps. It is not, in other words, "just minutes" from Vatican City-- more like a 20 minute hardcore hike. My roommate and I were here a month, for which we paid the obscene equivalent of nearly 3000 USD for a crappy apartment masquerading as a four-star hotel. Keep in mind that we could have easily booked a room elsewhere for quarter of this price. I know, because I lived in Rome for several years and am quite familiar with housing and rental costs here. For years, for example, I rented a room in an apartment in the real city center of Rome for $350/month. So imagine my irritation at spending many times that for no amenities, no location, no service, and so on. Had we known that the amenities advertised on the website were not in fact available here, we'd have booked elsewhere, but we didn't learn anything about the true lack of amenities until the night before we arrived in Rome, when it was too late to book another accommodation. One important side note: if you're a young attractive female, beware of Villa Tassoni. One of the desk clerks kept asking me out and when I gave him a firm "no thank you", he was surly with me for the rest of my stay and wouldn't help me with anything. Residence Villa Tassoni is not the worst place I've ever stayed in Rome, but it definitely does not live up to its "four star hotel" purported reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: NycWorldtraveler79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Tassoni for one month during a graduate school program. I did not encounter any problems during my stay, in fact, it was very pleasant. I stayed in a one bedroom suite which was clean, spacious and equipped with a kitchenette which was sufficient for cooking small meals. The bathroom was very nice with up-to-date fixtures and plenty of hot water. I had a very nice balcony which overlooked Via delle Medaglie d'Oro. I found that this location was just far enough away from the business of the city to be quiet but close enough for convenience to city center via bus or subway. A cab from centro storico to this location only cost around 10-12 Euros. I found the staff to be very friendly and willing to help with any request. The only drawback to this location is that there are no air conditioners in the rooms which would have been nice as there was a week-long heat wave while I was there. But it's Europe - hardly anyone besides the big chain hotels have air conditioners. All that aside, when I asked the staff for a fan, it was in my room in 10 minutes! Overall, it was a pleasant experience and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: devils987
Reviews.Content: This is a nice out of the way place to stay. It's not in the heart of the city, and has a special allure for that reason. It is still easily accessible by foot, bus, metro, or car. The hotel is a converted mansion and that makes it a very unique place to stay, yet still has unique 40 rooms. All of the staff are very nice and (try to be) helpful, all speack english. My room was very sunny with a nice view, and nice cross breeze which made my stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: Thanasis1212
Reviews.Content: Great, non-tourist location, easy to reach the city center. Spacious and clean room-great view (trees etc.). The room and the view was exactly as on the hotel's website virtual tour. Friendly staff. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again......”
Reviews.Author: RaspberryJelly
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Villa Tassoni for two weeks over Easter 2006. We had booked online direct with the hotel, paid our deposit and had no problems.... until we arrived. Getting into the hotel was fine, the owner was pretty abrupt (but I’m sure that was just his charming manner!) ...we had to settle the rest of our payment by debit card on arrival...but it seems the Italians are not so up on chip and pin, the owner told us he could not accept payment because he had to put a password into the machine and he didn't know it so we would have to pay cash....we tried to explain that it was our pin which needed to be input...he didn't seem so happy, not entirely sure why!...but finally allowed us into his tiny, tiny office to complete the transaction. We were then taken upstairs to our room and briefly shown around. The room wasn't entirely what we expected.....we were self catering but the room lacked a cooked/grill...(limiting us to boiled/fried food!!) when we asked the owner said we had been given the room we asked for and he couldn't move us anywhere else because all rooms were full. The light in the bathroom didn't work but we were assured that it would be fixed the following day (which it was) but in the meantime we were left with live wires hanging out of the wall. The bathroom shower also lacked hot water and was not very suitable for anyone over 5'10" as the shower head was at a very low level and could not be moved at all (I am nearing 6foot and my partner is 6’3”) The room was clean and to a satisfactory level, with a lovely balcony surrounded by trees, loads of wardrobe space. On the first night whilst unpacking though my partner was sat on the end of the bed perusing the local TV channels when the bed collapsed beneath him! On further inspection the bed frame seemed to have been welded together from a previous breakage. He tried to pull the bed legs back into place but sliced his arm on a large piece of metal sticking out from the frame. We went downstairs (with his bleeding arm wrapped crudely in the medical supplies I had with me) only to find that no one but the porter was around (who spoke no English) we tried to explain what had happened and were ushered into a small room with a sink where the porter dabbed my partners arm with some damp toilet paper…realising this would not suffice he recommended we go to the hospital, but couldn’t tell us where the nearest one was!…We wandered outside, looked up and saw right next door a huge neon green cross, we walked into the reception area not really having any idea of where we were, flashed my partners wound at the receptionist and were whisked away by a doctor. I don’t think it was a hospital….but the staff were very useful and stitched his arm up. There was no management at our apartment because they were on holiday over Easter, our bed was replaced by the porter, but was nothing better than a camping bed. The bus stop outside the villa was excellent though, we caught the 913 everyday into the centre of Rome…we were also very close to a number of restaurants, supermarkets, bakery etc. The location of Villa Tassoni is very nice; it is just a shame about the experiences we had. We would not visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had stayed somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: romaround
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the Villa from the virtual tour offered on the internet site. We were looking forward to get to Villa Tassoni to relax and enjoy Rome. On arrival in 90 degree heat the villa was locked and no amount of ringing on the Reception bell would bring any response, so we were left standing in the street. Eventually we were let in by an elderly gentleman who said the receptionist had gone for a walk! When he did arrive about 20 minutes later he told us we should have rung first... we were not instructed to do this on the paperwork. We checked in at reception which was no more than a pokey office and were taken to our double room. As soon as we walked in the smell hit you, it was musty and dirty, the walls were covered in mould and when this was pointed out the receptionist said he had not ever noticed it. We asked to be moved to another room but he said he could offer us nothing better, when we said we would not stay there we were told that we would have to pay for our stay whatever. On our insistance that we were mislead by the virtual tour (which he said he knew nothing about) we were eventually moved to another Tassoni residence. It was immediatly apparent that this was where the virtual tour was done - it may have been us that misread the info but whichever way the website is very misleading. This residence was at least clean, except for the pillow cases which were changed upon request. However, there was no air conditioning and in the heat and with the problem of mosquitos our three night stay was to say the least miserable. The rooms are not serviced so from Friday to Monday we had no clean towels and the reception is not manned. I would suggest that the owners of both these residences take a close look at what they are offering. They said the prices were cheap but for what they actually offer I would beg to differ. Rome is beautiful but the Tassoni residences are most certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Many problems”
Reviews.Author: barbaradt
Reviews.Content: The location was the best thing about this place. .. thats the reason for the 2 stars. We didn't get the rooms we reserved. When they offered us an alternative, the place was dirty. Had not been cleaned in awhile. So we were moved again. This place had not been cleaned either...and no supplies for us to even do it ourselves. We asked for fans, and they kept putting us off. Finally on day four..the fans came...but we had to wait til evening so they could put them together. They were in no hurry to accomodate us..and the weather was brutally hot. There was some gold jewelry missing from one of our rooms. This particular room didn't have a safe...so the gold was hidden in the armoir underneath blankets. When the office was notified....suddenly the jewelry was found. Seems that when the cleaning personnel took the blankets out of the armoir (no reason to remove the blankets...it was 90 degrees) they said the jewelry fell out. Why they didn't leave the jewelry where it was....well you decide for yourself. The small (dorm size) refrigerator only kept things barely cool. The plug to the so called microwave oven (which I don't know what kind of oven it was...certainly wasn't a microwave or convection) broke. Waited a day for that to be taken care of. There was a big arch window over french doors leading to the living area (which doubled as sleeping area at night) had no kind of shade or shutter to close..and it got the hot afternoon sun...which made things very hot and uncomfortable. Like I said in the beginning....we did not get the room they show on the internet..and thats what we reserved. Don't try to use Euro travelers checks here..they won't take them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large and very clean - all amenities provided. Staff was extremely gracious and very willing to help. Villa is bus line to Rome and in a great neighborhood. NOT "touristy" feeling at all. I felt safe and cared for. I would not want to stay anywhere else if I ever had the chance to visit Rome again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful friendly place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Villa Tassoni the first week in November. I cannot express how friendly the staff was. The manger, Christian was so very helpful. He showed us how to get around Rome using the bus and underground. He explained how things worked and gave us maps on where things of interest were and how to get there. He did his very best to make us comfortable and feel like we were welcome. Staying at this hotel, visiting the Valtican, the Colosseam and Palantine was the highlite of our Italy vacation. We enjoyed this so much more than Venice and plan to reurn as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “horrible!”
Reviews.Author: klkh2002
Reviews.Content: The Villa Tassoni looks wonderful in the photos. Unfortunately, it is nothing like that in reality. The hotel is very old and run down, the rooms are tiny, the bathrooms are almost scary to use and the kitchen disgraceful. The safe in the room is a joke. My grandmother could kick it off and run off with it (all right, she couldn't run but you get the point) It is near to nowhere and during the night, there were street kids running around and yelling all hours of the nights. It did not feel safe at all. Not recommended!

Reviews.Title: “review of Villa Tassoni”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would like to recommend Villa Tassoni as an excellent place to stay in Rome Italy. It is very clean and the appartments are roomy. It is close to very good restruants and transportion. Also a few blocks from the Vatican. We have stayed there for a month for the past three years. We expect to go back this year. The staff at Villa Tassoni is very helpful and curtious. yours truly Mrs. Audrey Higby

Reviews.Title: “loved villa tassoni, wouldn't stay anywhere else in rome”
Reviews.Author: jon4224
Reviews.Content: Villa Tassoni is one of the best places to stay in rome. situated a few short miles from Vatican City, this hotel is in a beautiful residential section of the city not seen by most tourists visiting rome. what also benefits the guests of villa tassoni is the fact that they have great restaurants and coffee shops located in the immediate proximity of the hotel. however, what i liked most about my stay at villa tassoni was the fact that the cambiaghi family, owners of the hotel, were so friendly and helpful. they really made an effort to treat me and my family with respect and were able to help if i had any needs regarding my room, or questions about places to dine or things to do. i have stayed at tassoni the last two years for one month at a time and have not had one single problem with the management or the hotel room. I highly recommend villa tassoni to anyone looking for a place to stay in rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Villa Tassoni
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Medaglie d'oro 138 | Andrea Cambiaghi, 00136 Rome, Italy
